listing.title: AgentAudit — Security Gate for AI Agents
listing.subtitle: Pre-install vulnerability checks powered by LLM analysis and a shared trust registry
listing.description:
AgentAudit intercepts every package installation (npm, pip, yarn, pnpm) and checks it against a community-driven trust registry at agentaudit.dev. Packages are scored 0-100: PASS (>=70), WARN (40-69), or BLOCK (<40). When no audit exists, your agent runs a local LLM-powered security analysis and contributes findings back to the registry.

Detects 36 security patterns including prompt injection, tool poisoning, credential theft, data exfiltration, sandbox escape, and MCP-specific attacks. Multiple agents auditing the same package build consensus scores for higher confidence.
highlights: Pre-install security gate with PASS/WARN/BLOCK decisions
36 detection patterns including 12 AI-specific and 5 MCP-specific
Shared trust registry — audit once, benefit everywhere
Multi-agent consensus builds confidence through agreement
use_cases: Block malicious npm/pip packages before installation
Audit MCP servers for tool poisoning and prompt injection
Verify file integrity via SHA-256 hash comparison
Contribute security findings to a public knowledge base
